body:
Comment 6 by **kaushansky**: 
I bent over backwards thinking where N^2 might come from, and I'm sure it comes from
miscalculation. 
Somehow you assume that when slice is made, it costs O(N). In fact, slice is cheap,
O(1). You can easily go one 
rune at a time, each time slicing it out, and it will still be O(N). In fact, strings
package does exactly this in 
explode() method. Probably comment about N^2 was made without due consideration.
